intro: Astragalus lycius f. acutiflorus, commonly known as the sharpflower milkvetch, is a subspecies of the milkvetch genus native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in steppe and desert environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in dryland gardens.
